summary: The Public Service Worker Protection Act (H.R. 3139) amends the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to extend its coverage to public employees. The bill removes the exclusion of public employees from the Act, effectively including federal, state, and local government workers. The amendment takes effect 90 days after enactment, with a 36-month delay for workplaces in states or political subdivisions without an approved state plan.
